data.title: Find a Job
data.text:
The Veterans' Employment and Training Service (VETS) is committed to helping America's veterans, separating service members and their spouses by preparing them for meaningful careers, providing employment resources and expertise.

CareerOneStop

Sponsored by the U.S. Department of Labor

Nearly 2,400 American Job Centers nationwide help people search for jobs, find training, and answer other employment related questions.

Find an American Job Center in your area (CareerOneStop.gov).

Search for a job right now by job description and location with CareerOneStop's Job Finder.

Search for a Job (CareerOneStop.gov)

CareerOneStop is your source for employment information and inspiration. It offers tools to help job seekers, students, businesses and career professionals.

How the Department of Labor and CareerOneStop helps veterans (YouTube)

Training Resources

Transition Assistance Employment for Military Spouses (TEAMS)

TEAMS is a series of Department of Labor employment workshops that extend the Department’s Transition Assistance Program to assist military spouses and caregivers as they plan and prepare for their job search in pursuit of their employment goals.

Off-Base Transition Training (OBTT)

The Department of Labor's OBTT pilot program is an opportunity earned through service for veterans, veterans currently serving in the National Guard and Reserve, and their spouses to take control of their career through workshops to help meet their employment goals.

DOL Transition Assistance Program

The employment assistance you need, for any time or transition.

CareerOneStop: Find Training

Find training programs, colleges, and universities in your local area.

Federal Job Resources

Veterans’ Preference

Veterans' preference may give you preference over non-veteran applicants in the hiring process. Veterans' preference can be used when applying to permanent and temporary positions in both the competitive and excepted service (of the executive branch).

Working in Government: Veterans (USAJobs.gov)

If you’re a veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. Armed Forces and were separated under honorable conditions, you may be eligible for veterans’ preference, as well as other veteran specific hiring options.

FedsHireVets.gov

Feds Hire Vets is an OPM website that is specifically designed for veterans to find resources about the federal hiring process. It is a critical component of the Federal Government’s strategy for the recruitment and employment of veterans.

HIREVets Awardees

See employers who hire our nations heroes.

VA Careers and Employment

Build your career and find the opportunities that are right for you.

National Labor Exchange

Search jobs from veteran friendly employers.

My Next Move

Search careers with keywords. Browse careers by industry. Find careers like your military job.

Job Accommodation Network

Identifies resources for people with disabilities to help secure a job.

SkillBridge

SkillBridge permits you to use up to the last 180 days of Service to train and learn with an industry partner. Any rank, enlisted or officer, may apply.
